services.name: General Veterinary Care

These sessions include thorough physical assessments, personalized vaccination plans, and discussions about preventative care strategies. We believe in empowering pet owners with knowledge to actively participate in the well-being of their furry companions, ensuring a long and fulfilling life for each pet.

services.name: Emergency and Critical Care
services.description: In times of urgent need, Fauna Animal Hospital stands as a steadfast ally with our 24/7 emergency and critical care services. Our commitment extends beyond the clock; we are prepared to handle a diverse range of critical situations, from severe injuries to sudden health crises. Equipped with state-of-the-art facilities and staffed by experienced professionals, we prioritize the immediate and comprehensive care required during your pet's most vulnerable moments.

services.name: Surgery
services.description: Within the walls of Fauna Animal Hospital, a team of highly skilled surgeons stands ready to perform a spectrum of surgeries with precision and care. Our surgical services encompass everything from routine procedures to complex interventions. Prioritizing the safety, comfort, and individual needs of each pet, our pre-surgery consultations ensure that pet owners are fully informed. Post-operative care is tailored to facilitate a smooth and comfortable recovery for every patient.

services.name: Dentistry
services.description: Recognizing the integral role of oral health in a pet's overall well-being, our dentistry services at Fauna Animal Hospital go beyond routine cleanings. We employ a comprehensive approach to oral care, conducting regular check-ups and offering advanced procedures such as extractions when necessary. Our focus is on preventative measures, ensuring the ongoing health of your pet's teeth and gums to enhance their overall quality of life.

services.name: Radiology
services.description: Fauna Animal Hospital harnesses cutting-edge imaging technology in our radiology services to provide precise diagnostic insights for various health conditions. From traditional X-rays to advanced imaging techniques, we ensure a thorough understanding of your pet's internal health. This commitment to advanced diagnostics enables our veterinary team to tailor treatment plans with accuracy and efficiency, promoting optimal outcomes for our patients.

services.name: Laboratory Services
services.description: At the core of our commitment to prompt and accurate diagnostics is the in-house laboratory at Fauna Animal Hospital. Swift assessment and monitoring of your pet's health are vital components of timely treatment. Our in-house testing capabilities not only enhance the efficiency of our veterinary care but also contribute to a comprehensive understanding of your pet's well-being, facilitating proactive and targeted healthcare.

services.name: Vaccinations
services.description: Protecting your pet from common diseases is a priority at Fauna Animal Hospital. Our comprehensive vaccination program is designed with individual factors in mind, such as age, lifestyle, and local disease prevalence. This personalized approach ensures that your pet receives the necessary vaccinations to safeguard their health, contributing to a long and happy life filled with vitality.

services.name: Pet Boarding
services.description: When you choose Fauna Animal Hospital for pet boarding, you are selecting more than just a facility; you are opting for a home away from home for your furry family member. Our boarding services go beyond the basics, offering a safe and nurturing environment where love, attention, and proper care are paramount. Our dedicated staff ensures that your pet's well-being is prioritized, providing you with peace of mind during your time away.

services.name: Grooming
services.description: Our grooming services at Fauna Animal Hospital are tailored to not only enhance the physical appearance of your pets but also contribute to their overall well-being. From relaxing baths to meticulous trims, our grooming sessions are designed with the unique needs and preferences of each pet in mind. Beyond aesthetics, regular grooming promotes a healthy coat and skin, while also fostering a positive and comfortable relationship between your pet and their grooming experience. Our goal is to ensure that your pet not only looks great but also feels great after every grooming session.

FAQ.question: How often should I schedule a check-up for my pet?
FAQ.answer: It's recommended to schedule a routine check-up for your pet at least once a year. However, for senior pets or those with specific health issues, more frequent visits may be necessary.

FAQ.question: What vaccinations does my pet need?
FAQ.answer: The specific vaccinations your pet needs depend on factors like their age, lifestyle, and local disease prevalence. Our veterinarians will create a customized vaccination plan for your pet.

FAQ.question: How can I maintain my pet's dental health at home?
FAQ.answer: Regularly brushing your pet's teeth, providing dental treats or toys, and feeding them dental-friendly diets can help maintain their oral health. Our dentistry services can also assist in this regard.

FAQ.question: What are the signs of a pet emergency?
FAQ.answer: Signs of a pet emergency may include difficulty breathing, severe injury, uncontrolled bleeding, seizures, sudden loss of consciousness, or ingestion of toxic substances. Contact us immediately if you suspect an emergency.

FAQ.question: How can I prepare my pet for surgery?
FAQ.answer: Our team will provide specific instructions, but generally, it's important to withhold food and water for a specified time before surgery. We'll also discuss any additional pre-surgery care your pet may need.

FAQ.question: What should I do if my pet is overweight?
FAQ.answer: If your pet is overweight, it's important to consult with our veterinarians to create a weight management plan. This may include a balanced diet and increased exercise to help your pet achieve and maintain a healthy weight.

FAQ.question: How can I help my pet cope with anxiety or fear during vet visits?
FAQ.answer: To help your pet with anxiety or fear, try to acclimate them to the vet's office with regular, stress-free visits. Bring their favorite toys or treats to make the experience more positive. Additionally, discuss anxiety-reducing options with our team.

FAQ.question: What are the common signs of dental problems in pets?
FAQ.answer: Common signs of dental problems in pets include bad breath, difficulty eating, pawing at the mouth, swollen or bleeding gums, and loose teeth. Regular dental check-ups can help prevent and address these issues.

FAQ.question: Do you offer pet insurance information or accept pet insurance for services?
FAQ.answer: We can provide information about pet insurance options and can assist with insurance claims for covered services. It's a good idea to explore pet insurance to help with unexpected healthcare costs.

FAQ.question: What should I do if I suspect my pet has ingested something toxic?
FAQ.answer: If you suspect your pet has ingested something toxic, contact us immediately or an emergency pet poison hotline. Try to identify the substance and quantity ingested if possible.

FAQ.question: How often should I deworm my pet, and what are the signs of a worm infestation?
FAQ.answer: The frequency of deworming depends on your pet's age, lifestyle, and local parasite risks. Common signs of worm infestations include diarrhea, vomiting, weight loss, and scooting. Consult with our veterinarians for a deworming schedule.

FAQ.question: What are the benefits of spaying or neutering my pet?
FAQ.answer: Spaying or neutering your pet can prevent unwanted pregnancies and reduce the risk of certain health issues. It can also help curb behavioral problems and reduce the pet population, benefiting both your pet and the community.

FAQ.question: How can I protect my pet from ticks and fleas?
FAQ.answer: Protect your pet from ticks and fleas with preventive medications. Regularly check your pet for these pests, especially after outdoor activities. Consult with our veterinarians for the most effective preventive measures.

FAQ.question: What are the signs of allergies in pets, and how can they be managed?
FAQ.answer: Signs of allergies in pets may include itching, skin problems, ear infections, and digestive issues. Management may involve identifying and avoiding allergens, medications, and dietary changes. Our team can help diagnose and manage allergies.

FAQ.question: What is the best way to introduce a new pet to my existing pets?
FAQ.answer: When introducing a new pet to your existing pets, do it gradually. Keep them separated initially, allow them to smell each other's scents, and supervise their first interactions. Seek advice from our team for a smooth introduction.

FAQ.question: How can I prepare for a long-distance trip with my pet?
FAQ.answer: To prepare for a long-distance trip with your pet, ensure they have proper identification and vaccinations. Plan rest stops, bring their essentials, and consult with our veterinarians for travel tips and safety measures.

FAQ.question: What is the importance of microchipping my pet?
FAQ.answer: Microchipping your pet provides a permanent means of identification. It greatly increases the chances of reuniting with your lost pet. Ensure the microchip information is up to date.
